quest.name: Listen to Your Fish
journal: Hihiyaja can point you in the direction of work.
According to Hihiyaja, Wowobaru of the Coffer & Coffin seeks to create a new fish dish. If you would assist this culinary endeavor, collect four slices of fatty orobon and donate them to Wowobaru.
You procure an ample supply of fatty orobon slices in the usual fashion. Make a gift of them to Wowobaru at the Coffer & Coffin.

Upon seeing your largesse of fatty fish, Wowobaru is struck by inspiration and immediately invents a new dish. He thanks you profusely for sparing him a costly process. Here in the heart of Thanalan, it would seem that fish are worth their weight in gold.
objectives: Offer the fatty orobon to Wowobaru.

dialogue.name: HIHIYAJA
dialogue.text: An idle adventurer is a sorry sight. I've no need of assistance at the moment, but perhaps someone at the Coffer & Coffin wants for a helping hand.

dialogue.name: HIHIYAJA
dialogue.text: Wowobaru, the resident chef, comes to mind. The man is obsessed with inventing new dishes, and I hear his current fascination is fish. If you were to donate some for his cause, I'm sure he'd be grateful.

dialogue.name: HIHIYAJA
dialogue.text: Now, I'm a simple farmer and don't know much about fish. But I do know what I like, and I like orobon. You won't find a more succulent fish in these parts, I tell you.

dialogue.name: HIHIYAJA
dialogue.text: If you have a mind to give some fish to Wowobaru, I can wholeheartedly recommend fatty orobon. Four slices or so should be enough for him to experiment with.

dialogue.name: WOWOBARU
dialogue.text: Fish, fish...futile! There are no suitable species! But I shall not surrender...

dialogue.name: WOWOBARU
dialogue.text: Orobon! Of course! But wait...how did you know of my epicurean endeavor?

dialogue.name: WOWOBARU
dialogue.text: Well, it matters not. The solution you suggest is sensational. Saut√© with salt, a squirt of sun lemon...so simple yet sublime!

dialogue.name: WOWOBARU
dialogue.text: Fish is a costly commodity here in Thanalan. Were it not for your local largesse, I would have been forced to fork out a fortune to have some brought hither. Thank you!
